intro: Parameria polyneura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed parameria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Its root system is capable of fixing atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Parameria polyneura is often found in open, sunny areas and is relatively drought-tolerant.
